data.title: 64th Annual L.A. County Holiday Celebration
data.meta_description: Enjoy L.A.’s favorite holiday tradition—the 64th Annual L.A. County Holiday Celebration.
data.text:
SITUATED ON THE ANCESTRAL AND SACRED LAND OF THE TONGVA AND MANY OTHER INDIGENOUS GROUPS WHO CALL THESE GROUNDS HOME, THE MUSIC CENTER ACKNOWLEDGES AND HONORS WITH GRATITUDE BOTH THE LAND ITSELF AND THE FIRST PEOPLE WHO HAVE STEWARDED IT THROUGHOUT THE GENERATIONS.

♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ [CHEERS AND APPLAUSE] >> THE GREAT MAYA ANGELOU ONCE SAID, "WE ALL SHOULD KNOW THAT DIVERSITY MAKES FOR A RICH TAPESTRY."

WELL, THERE IS NO RICHER TAPESTRY THAN THE VARIETY OF CULTURES AND COMMUNITIES WOVEN TOGETHER, THAT CONNECTS ALL OF US IN L.A. COUNTY.

WITH ALMOST 10 MILLION PEOPLE, OF ALL ETHNICITIES, BACKGROUNDS, AND JOURNEYS, FROM THE OCEAN TO THE MOUNTAINS TO THE DESERT, OURS IS THE LARGEST COUNTY IN THE ENTIRE UNITED STATES.

THE HOLIDAYS OFFER US A JOYFUL CHANCE TO EXPERIENCE AND CELEBRATE THIS WIDE WORLD OF TRADITIONS, LANGUAGES, AND FAITHS.

TODAY, ALONG WITH FAMILY AND FRIENDS, WE HONOR HOW LOS ANGELES CELEBRATES THE HOLIDAYS AND ALL THAT IT HAS TO OFFER IN ART, MUSIC AND DANCE.

FROM VENICE BEACH TO THE MOJAVE DESERT, WHEREVER YOU'RE WATCHING TODAY, WELCOME, ONE AND ALL, TO THE 64TH ANNUAL L.A. COUNTY HOLIDAY CELEBRATION.

[CHEERS AND APPLAUSE] >> Suzanna: HAPPY HOLIDAYS AND WELCOME TO THE LOS ANGELES COUNTY HOLIDAY CELEBRATION!

I'M SUZANNA GUZMAN AND IT'S MY PLEASURE TO BE BACK HOSTING THIS BEAUTIFUL EVENT INSIDE THE MUSIC CENTER'S ICONIC DOROTHY CHANDLER PAVILION.

AND THIS HOLIDAY SEASON, I'M SO GRATEFUL TO HAVE THE BEAUTIFUL GIFT OF A WONDERFUL NEW CO-HOST, A GIFTED ACTOR, A PASSIONATE DISABILITY ADVOCATE AND MY NEW FRIEND DANNY J. GOMEZ!

>> Danny: THANKS SO MUCH, SUZANNA.

I FEEL SO HONORED TO BE CO-HOSTING WITH THIS GREAT MEZZO-SOPRANO AND EMMY AWARD-WINNING HOST - AND TO BE WELCOMED WITH OPEN ARMS AS A PART OF THIS FABULOUS CELEBRATION HERE AT THE MUSIC CENTER IN DOWNTOWN LOS ANGELES.

EVERYONE IS INVITED TO BE A PART OF THESE FESTIVITIES.

AND IT'S FUN AND FREE FOR THE WHOLE FAMILY.

THE PARKING IS FREE TOO!

>> Suzanna: WE'RE HERE CELEBRATING ALL OF THE HOLIDAYS AND CULTURAL TRADITIONS, AS WELL AS THE EXTRAORDINARY, DIVERSE AND HEARTWARMING ARTISTRY OF PERFORMERS FROM EACH AND EVERY CORNER OF THE BIGGEST AND YES, I'M GOING TO SAY IT - THE BEST COUNTY IN THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA.

>> Danny: YOU KNOW, SUZANNA, THERE'S AN EXPRESSION THAT GOES BACK ABOUT 2000 YEARS - "HOME IS WHERE THE HEART IS."

AND TODAY, NO MATTER WHERE WE COME FROM, ALL OF OUR HEARTS ARE RIGHT HERE IN LOS ANGELES COUNTY - A WONDERFUL WORLD UNTO ITSELF WITH OVER 10 MILLION PEOPLE.

THAT'S LARGER THAN THE POPULATION OF 40 STATES, BRINGING TOGETHER AN AMAZING DIVERSITY OF BACKGROUNDS AND CULTURES.

FOR 64 YEARS NOW, THIS HAS ALSO BEEN A VERY BIG, VERY SPECIAL HOLIDAY EVENT THANKS TO THE GENEROSITY OF THE L.A. COUNTY BOARD OF SUPERVISORS.

>> Suzanna: THAT'S RIGHT, AND TO ANSWER A QUESTION THAT THE BEATLES ASKED ONCE UPON A TIME, "WE DO STILL NEED YOU WHEN WE'RE 64."

AND WE NEED EVERY SINGLE ONE OF YOU.

BECAUSE WHEREVER YOU LIVE, WHATEVER HOLIDAY YOU CELEBRATE, WHICHEVER GIFTS YOU HAVE AND CHALLENGES YOU FACE, WE WELCOME YOU AND THANK YOU FOR CELEBRATING THIS SEASON OF LIGHT AND LOVE TOGETHER WITH US.

AND YOU CAN LET YOUR FAMILY AND FRIENDS ACROSS THE NATION KNOW WE ARE LIVE STREAMING ON PBS SOCAL AND KCET SO THEY CAN WATCH AS WELL.

>> Danny: BEING HERE TODAY IS A HOLIDAY GIFT FOR ME.

SO, I WANT TO SHARE SOMETHING I'VE LEARNED IN MY LIFE, AND YES, IN THIS WHEELCHAIR.

BACK IN 2016, I NEARLY DIED IN A MOUNTAIN BIKING ACCIDENT THAT LEFT ME PARALYZED FROM THE WAIST DOWN.

BUT RATHER THAN BEING A TRAGEDY, THAT CHALLENGE HAS BROUGHT MY LIFE MUCH DEEPER MEANING AND PURPOSE.

IT GAVE MY LIFE NEW PASSION, BOTH AS AN ACTOR AND AS AN ADVOCATE FOR MAKING OUR WORLD A MORE ACCESSIBLE AND INCLUSIVE PLACE.

IT WAS A GIFT I NEVER SAW COMING - JUST LIKE THIS OPPORTUNITY TO CELEBRATE WITH ALL OF YOU.

>> Suzanna: DANNY, YOU ARE A GIFT.

SPEAKING ABOUT BEAUTIFUL GIFTS - WHAT ABOUT OUR OPENING PERFORMANCE TODAY OF JAY-Z'S "SHOW ME WHAT YOU GOT" BY SOUTH SIDE SYMPHONY?!

THEY REALLY SHOWED US WHAT THEY'VE GOT - DIDN'T THEY?!

AND THAT BEAUTIFULLY REFLECTS THE SONG'S MESSAGE WHICH IS ABOUT CELEBRATING YOUR TALENTS, WORKING HARD AND BELIEVING IN YOURSELF.

>> Danny: COMPOSER AND CONDUCTOR DR. MARCUS NORRIS FOUNDED THAT AMAZING ORCHESTRA THAT'S WORKED WITH CHLOE & HALLIE AND ANDRA DAY, TO NAME JUST SOME OF THEIR IMPRESSIVE COLLABORATORS.

>> Suzanna: BASED IN WINDSOR HILLS, THE ORCHESTRA'S MOTTO IS "OUR MUSIC IN OUR TIME."

AND NOW, JUST IN TIME, PERFORMING THEIR NEW SEASONAL CLASSIC "MERRY THICC-MAS," PLEASE WELCOME BACK SOUTH SIDE SYMPHONY!

♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ [CHEERS AND APPLAUSE] >> Suzanna: DANNY, SOUTH SIDE SYMPHONY IS ONE OF THE 11 NEW GROUPS WE'RE FEATURING IN THE HOLIDAY CELEBRATION THIS YEAR.

>> Danny: SUZANNA, AS ONE OF THE GREAT OPERATIC VOICES OF OUR TIMES, WHAT DO YOU LOVE MOST ABOUT ALL THE AMAZING SINGERS - OF ALL AGES AND FROM SO MANY BACKGROUNDS - PERFORMING FOR US TODAY?

>> Suzanna: DANNY, I HAVE TO SAY I LOVE ALL OF IT.

BUT WHAT I THINK I LOVE MOST IS SEEING EVERYBODY SING THEIR HEARTS OUT IN THEIR OWN WAYS.

>> Danny: ABSOLUTELY, SUZANNA.

THIS NEXT NEW GROUP IS REALLY GOING TO RAISE OUR HOLIDAY SPIRITS EVEN HIGHER - IN FACT, IT'S RIGHT THERE IN THEIR NAME.

I'M TALKING ABOUT LOS ANGELES'S VERY OWN SOUL/GOSPEL/R&B CHOIR, AND IN THE NEW YEAR, THEY WILL BE CELEBRATING THEIR 10TH ANNIVERSARY SHARING THEIR GORGEOUS VOICES AND THEIR BEAUTIFUL SPIRITS AND SPREADING COMFORT AND JOY TO ONE AND ALL.

>> Suzanna: HERE TO "TELL IT ON A MOUNTAIN" AS ONLY THEY CAN - RAISE!

THE MAJORITY OF THE DANCERS STARTED AS A HOBBY AND NOW IT'S PART OF THEIR LIVES.

WHEN WE TEACH FOLKLORICO DANCE, WE'RE TRYING TO SHARE THE KNOWLEDGE ABOUT THE TRADITIONS.

SOME OF THE DANCERS, THEY KNOW WHERE THEY COME FROM, BUT THEY DON'T KNOW ANYTHING ABOUT IT.

SO, I THINK IT'S REALLY IMPORTANT, LIKE LEARNING THE DIFFERENCE BETWEEN JALISCO OR METRICAN OR YUCATAN.

SO THIS IS THE TYPE MUSIC, THIS IS TYPE FOOD, THIS IS THE COSTUMES, TRYING TO EXPLAIN IT MORE LIKE THE COLORS OF THE CULTURE.

WE'RE GOING TO DO A PIECE OF COLIMA, IT'S A TROPICAL AREA IN MEXICO.

THIS PARTICULAR CHOREOGRAPHY IT'S ABOUT THE BEAUTY OF THE PEOPLE, SUNDAY THEY GO TO THE PLAZA, THE COLOR, THE SKIRTS, THE MOVEMENT WITH THE SKIRTS, THE DANCERS IMITATE THE BIRDS.

HOLIDAYS ARE LIKE ONE OF THE THINGS THAT YOU'LL NEVER FORGET.

CHRISTMAS, DIA DE LOS MUERTOS, THE POTLUCKS WITH THE FAMILY, EVERYBODY CAN SHARE, YOU KNOW, LIKE THEIR GRANDMA'S RECIPE.

AND I THINK IT'S WONDERFUL TO CONNECT THROUGH THE DANCE ALL THIS TRADITION WITH THE COMMUNITY HERE.

>> Danny: HERE TO TRANSPORT US TO MEXICO WITH MARIACHI MUSIC AND A BEAUTIFUL DANCE INSPIRED BY THE TRADITIONS AND COLORFUL COSTUMES OF THE STATE OF COLIMA - PLEASE WELCOME TECNICA ARTE Y FOLKLORE!

[CHEERS AND APPLAUSE] ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ [CHEERS AND APPLAUSE] >> I AM SO GLAD YOU HAVE CHOSEN TO SPEND YOUR CHRISTMAS HOLIDAY HERE WITH US.

THE CELEBRATION IS IMPORTANT TO MY OWN FAMILY.

WHEN DOROTHY CHANDLER WANTED TO BUILD THE MUSIC PLANNER, SHE CAME TO EACH OF THE MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF SUPERVISORS FOR THEIR APPROVAL.

MY DAD SAID YES ON ONE CONDITION.

THAT THE MUSIC CENTER BE FREE TO THE PUBLIC ONE DAY EACH YEAR AND THIS BEAUTIFUL CELEBRATION WAS BORN.

WHETHER YOU ARE WATCHING AT HOME OR IN PERSON, I WOULD LIKE TO WISH EACH AND EVERY ONE OF YOU A HAPPY HOLIDAY SEASON FILLED WITH JOY AND PEACE.

>> Danny: THANK YOU, SUPERVISOR HAHN.

TODAY WE'RE SENDING OUR PROGRAM TO OUR ACTIVE MILITARY THROUGH THE AMERICAN FORCES NETWORK.

WE WISH YOU HAPPY HOLIDAYS AND A HEALTHY NEW YEAR.

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SERVICE.

>> Suzanna: WE LOVE SEEING ALL THESE KIDS HERE TODAY.

I BROUGHT MY SON HERE WHEN HE WAS FIVE YEARS OLD.

I'M PRETTY SURE WE KNOW THE ANSWER, BUT DO WE HAVE ANY KIDS HERE IN OUR AUDIENCE TODAY?

>> Danny: WE THOUGHT SO, AND SUZANNA AND I ARE THRILLED TO HAVE EACH AND EVERY ONE OF YOU HERE AT THE L.A. COUNTY HOLIDAY CELEBRATION.

>> Suzanna: RIGHT NOW, AN EXCELLENT VOCAL ENSEMBLE FROM PASADENA.

>> Danny: 'TIS ALWAYS THE SEASON FOR LIFTING OUR VOICES AND LIFTING UP ONE ANOTHER.

THAT'S WHAT OUR NEXT WONDERFUL GROUP OF YOUNG WOMEN AGES 7 TO 17 FROM PASADENA DO UNDER THE EXPERT DIRECTION OF BARBARA ALLEN.

THESE KINDS OF PERFORMANCES FILL US WITH HOPE FOR THE FUTURE.

>> Suzanna: AND TODAY, WE'RE SO THANKFUL THEY'RE HERE TO PERFORM NOT ONE, BUT TWO HEARTWARMING BLASTS OF FUN FOR US.

WHAT A PLEASURE TO WELCOME PASADENA GIRLS CHOIR!

>> Danny: FOUNDED IN 2000 BY BRYAN YAMAME, LITTLE TOKYO'S ACCLAIMED DRUM ENSEMBLE TAIKO PROJECT HAS BEEN A GLOBAL SENSATION FOR OVER TWO DECADES WITH ITS MODERN AMERICAN EXPRESSION OF TRADITIONAL JAPANESE DRUMMING - WHETHER THEY'RE RECORDING WITH HANS ZIMMER FOR THE TOKYO OLYMPICS OR PERFORMING RIGHT HERE IN LOS ANGELES AT GLOBAL EVENTS LIKE THE ACADEMY AWARDS AND THE GRAMMYS.

>> Suzanna: BUT WAIT, THERE'S MORE.

L.A.'S VERY OWN BLUE13 DANCE COMPANY WAS FOUNDED OVER TWO DECADES AGO BY ACHINTA MCDANIEL, A PIONEER OF CONTEMPORARY INDIAN DANCE.

INSPIRED BY CLASSICAL AND CULTURAL ART FORMS OF THE INDIAN SUBCONTINENT, THEY PERFORM THEATRICAL MODERN DANCE FOR WHICH THEY HAVE BECOME KNOWN AND ADMIRED ALL AROUND THE WORLD.

>> Danny: A DRUMROLL AND BIG WELCOME BACK TO TAIKO PROJECT AND BLUE13 DANCE COMPANY!

[APPLAUSE] ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ [CHEERS AND APPLAUSE] >> THE CHORALE HAS BEEN TOGETHER SINCE 2004, BUT THERE ARE SEVERAL CHOIR MEMBERS THAT HAVE BEEN SINGING WITH ME SINCE I WAS THIRTEEN OR FOURTEEN YEARS OLD.

AND A LOT OF THE OTHER CHOIR MEMBERS HAVE BEEN WITH ME OVER 20 YEARS.

WE HAVE CATHOLICS, WE HAVE EPISCOPALIANS, WE HAVE CHURCH OF GOD IN CHRIST, WE HAVE BAPTISTS, WE HAVE LUTHERANS.

AND WE ALL LOVE MUSIC AND WE ALL LOVE THE LORD AND WE BELIEVE IN COMING TOGETHER MAKING A JOYFUL NOISE.

WE DO A VARIETY OF MUSIC.

OUR REPERTOIRE HAS GONE FROM ANTHEMS, SPIRITUALS, GOSPEL, R&B THEMES, SO WE ARE NOT LIMITED TO WHAT WE CAN DO.

SAY, EVERY EVENT THAT WE HAVE, WE TRY TO ATTACH OUR MISSION ENDEAVOR.

INSTEAD OF SELLING TICKETS, WE COLLECTED SCHOOL SUPPLIES, AND THERE'S A SCHOOL RIGHT HERE IN LONG BEACH THAT HAS A LARGE POPULATION OF STUDENTS THAT ARE LIVING IN THEIR CARS WITH THEIR PARENTS AND SO WE DONATED THOSE SCHOOL SUPPLIES.

USUALLY, CHRISTMAS IS A TIME THAT WE REALLY FOCUS ON GIVING OUR BEST PERFORMANCE, BECAUSE MUSIC IS SUCH A STRONG PART OF THE HOLIDAY.

WHERE EVERYBODY, YOU KNOW, SINGS "JOY TO THE WORLD" OR "SILENT NIGHT", SO WE JUST FOCUS ON DOING DIFFERENT ARRANGEMENTS.

>> Suzanna: THEY ARE SO INSPIRING.

>> Danny: I REALLY ENJOYED THAT.

UNDER THE LEADERSHIP OF THEIR FOUNDER TIMOTHY WILLIAMS, PLEASE WELCOME CHRISTIAN FELLOWSHIP CHORALE!

DANI SAYS WHEN IT COMES TO BLENDING LANGUAGES AND MUSICAL STYLES, NOBODY DOES IT QUITE LIKE OUR NEXT OUTSTANDING PERFORMER, JESSICA FICHOT.

HAVING GROWN UP OUTSIDE PARIS WITH A CHINESE MOTHER AND FRENCH FATHER, SHE EMBRACES HER ETHNICALLY DIVERSE HERITAGE AND SINGS FLUENTLY IN FRENCH, MANDARIN-CHINESE AND ENGLISH.

>> Suzanna: AND IF THAT ISN'T MULTICULTURAL ENOUGH, SHE GETS HER UNIQUE MUSICAL SOUND BY COMBINING FRENCH CHANSON, GYPSY JAZZ, FOLK AND WORLD MUSIC.

JESSICA AND HER FIERY BAND ARE BASED IN ATWATER VILLAGE.

THEY BLEND CULTURES REFLECTING L.A.'S INCREDIBLE DIVERSITY.

FIRST, THEY WILL WHET OUR APPETITES WITH A TASTE OF THE FRENCH CHRISTMAS CLASSIC "PETIT PAPA NOEL."

AND THEN THEY WILL BE PERFORMING TWO ORIGINAL SONGS THAT JESSICA WROTE.

PLEASE SAY "BONJOUR" TO JESSICA FICHOT.
